intro: Cryptantha echinosepala, commonly known as the spiny-sepaled cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique feature is the spiny structure on the sepals, which gives it its common name. Cryptantha echinosepala is often found in open grasslands and along mountain slopes.
